job_title: Développeur intelligence d'affaires et Big data / Business Intelligence and Big Data Developer
industries: Airlines and Aviation
description:
Qui sommes-nous? : 


Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.





Description de la fonction: 


Le développeur d’intelligence d’affaires et Big Data travaillera avec l'équipe analytique et gestion des données de l'organisation Logistique Globale & Planification d'activité intégrée. Le candidat sera responsable du développement, de la maintenance et l’assistance aux outils d'analyse de données (bases de données SQL Server et procédures stockées, rapports Power BI, algorithmes d'apprentissage machine, etc.) pour soutenir les processus de logistique d'entreprise. Le candidat travaillera avec l’analyste en intelligence d’affaires et de la chaîne d'approvisionnement pour remodeler les outils existants et créer la nouvelle génération d'outils d'analyse numérique dans SQL Server, Big Data Hadoop et Cloud (Azure et AWS). De plus, le candidat doit collaborer avec les différentes équipes de l'organisation de technologies numériques pour assurer la qualité des données et la viabilité des ETL dans les systèmes d’entrepôts de données de l'organisation Logistique Globale & Planification d'activité intégrée. (SQL Server DataMart et Hadoop DataLake).





Énoncés de responsabilité: 



Automatisation de la transformation et intégration de données

Faire la conception, programmation, contrôle et documentation des ETLs, base de données, rapports, OLAP et outils analytiques

Développer des requêtes complexes SQL dans l’environnement SQL Server, HIVE et SPark

Effectuer de la programmation Python avancée

Produire une programmation de haute qualité qui est durable et bien documentée

Travailler en collaboration avec l’analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et d’intelligence d’affaires afin de mettre en place des outils analytiques et Big Data

Exécution et documentation des tests d’approbation d’utilisateur

Créer et maintenir la documentation du design conceptuel et le code généré

Travailler avec différentes équipes technologies numériques afin d’assurer l’intégrité des données

Assister le développement et la maintenance de rapport Power BI

Fournir une assistance technique à l’analyste Intelligence d’Affaires et Chaîne d’Approvisionnement






Qualifications requises: 



Baccalauréat avec 3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire.

Certificat en intelligence d’affaires et Big Data (atout majeur)

Forte expérience dans la conception et l’utilisation d’outils Microsoft Business Intelligence (T-SQL, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI), Big Data (HDFS, Hive, Spark, SQOOP, etc.) et Cloud (Azure et AWS)

Expérience avec SAP et données de chaîne approvisionnement (atout majeur)

Forte communication et auto-motivation pour travailler avec des données complexes de chaine approvisionnement;

Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes

Compétences en gestion de projet (approche agile)

Bilingue, doit parler couramment l'anglais (oral et écrit)






Ce qui vous attend 



Programme de congé à rémunération différée

Garderie pour jeunes enfants

Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation

Horaires flexibles

Programmes et formations sur le leadership

Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite

Programme d’aide de financement pour les congés parentaux

Programme de reconnaissance et de récompense






Diversité et inclusion: 


Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.





English version 






Who we are:


At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.





Function Description: 


The Business Intelligence and Big Data developer will work with the Analytics & Data Management team in Global Logistics and Integrated Business Planning organization. The candidate will be responsible to develop, maintain and sustain data analytics tools (SQL Server databases and stored procedures, Power BI reports, Machine Learning algorithms, etc.) to support Enterprise Logistics processes. The candidate will work with the Supply Chain Analytics Scientist to revamp the existing tools and to build the new generation of the digital analytics tools in SQL Server, Big Data Hadoop and Cloud (Azure and AWS). Also, the candidate has to collaborate with the different teams in the Digital Technology organization to ensure the data quality and sustainability of the ETLs in the Global Logistics Data Warehouse systems (SQL Server DataMart and Hadoop DataLake).





Responsibility Statements: 



Automate data integration and transformation

Design, code, test and document ETLs, databases, reports, OLAP and analytics tools

Develop complex SQL queries in SQL Server, Hive and Spark

Perform advanced Python programming

Deliver high quality codes that are maintainable and well documented

Work with the Supply Chain Analytics Scientist to deploy the new Analytics and Big Data tools

Conduct and document User Acceptance Tests

Create and maintain the documentation of the logical design and codes produced

Work with the different IT teams to ensure data quality

Support the development and maintenance of Power BI reports

Provide technical assistance to the Global Logistics Business Intelligence analysts






Qualifications required:



Bachelor’s degree with over 3 years' experience in a similar role

Certification in Business Intelligence and Big Data (strong asset)

Strong experience with design and use of Microsoft Business Intelligence tools (T-SQL, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI), Big Data (HDFS, Hive, Spark, SQOOP, etc.) and Cloud (Azure and AWS)

Experience with SAP and Supply Chain data (strong asset)

Strong communication and self-motivation to work with complex supply chain data

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Project Management skills (agile approach)

Bilingual, must be fluent in English (oral and written)


Field of studies:
 Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering,






What we offer:



Long-term deferred compensation programs

Daycare for young children

Advancement programs to enhance education skills

Flexible work schedules

Leadership and training programs

Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans

Financial support for parental leave

Reward programs for outstanding work






Diversity and inclusion: 


The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Site Reliability Engineer





Here at mthree, we pair talented graduates with leading global businesses. We’re always on the lookout for ambitious graduates to join the mthree Alumni Graduate Program, kick-starting your tech career within an entry-level SRE role and working onsite with a leading fintech organization in Montreal, Quebec.




Our 24-month graduate program begins with 4-8 weeks of paid training and career coaching, where you’ll learn everything, you need to hit the ground running as a software developer.

After you've completed the paid training, you'll have the opportunity to fast-track your career at a global investment bank or leading tech company.





Profile: 



Interested in distributed systems and working with highly scalable and reliable services.

Like to work in a fast-moving environment and you aren't afraid to change things to make them better.

Enjoy new technological challenges and solving hard problems.

Believe a team working well together is smarter than the single smartest person on that team.

Have grit, drive and a deep sense of ownership.

Working closely with engineering/development teams to design, build, and maintain systems.

Troubleshooting issues across the entire technology stack: hardware, software, application, and network.

Identifying and driving opportunities to improve automation for our platforms; scope and create automation for deployment, management, and visibility of our services.

Proactively identifying and addressing systems reliability risks.

Working alongside existing global and regional team members on a follow-the-sun basis.

Represent the RPE organization in design reviews and operational readiness exercises for new and existing services. Skill Set

Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot problems and debug to identify root cause.

Hands on experience on enterprise tools such as AppDynamics, Grafana, Splunk, Dynatrace.

Experience with Ansible, GitHub or any automation/configuration/release management tools.

Automation-related experience is particularly valued using scripting languages such as python, bash, perl, ruby.One higher level language is desired.

 Awareness of, and ability to reason about modern software and systems architectures, including load-balancing, databases, queueing, caching, distributed systems failure modes, micro services, Cloud, etc.





 
Pre-requisites:



Practical experience running large scale systems is an advantage. Qualifications/Criterion

Bachelor’s Degree, BE/ Btech





 
What you’ll receive:



Fully paid, in-depth and interactive training with a diverse group of like-minded graduates, delivered by experts with working knowledge of the field.

A competitive graduate salary

Pay increases every 6 months

A complete well-being program and full benefits package

Ongoing training and pastoral care

Invaluable industry experience and the opportunity to start a career in a desirable and competitive industry





DIVERSITY:


We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making mthree the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within mthree and with our partner companies, and we’re proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish by promoting a strong culture of equality but most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for mthree.

Passionné.e de la donnée mais prisonnier.ère de ton quotidien?


Tu es passionné.e d'ETL, fan d’entrepôt de données, enthousiaste de l’expérience client et de la dynamique d’équipe et tu aimes la diversité dans tes mandats? Libère-toi et joins-toi à notre équipe comme développeur BI. Partenaire Gold Microsoft (certification Data Analytics), nous ne faisons que du BI depuis 30 ans et nous avons une diversité de clients qui garantit que tu ne t’ennuieras jamais au sein de notre équipe d’experts!





Tu as les clés pour t’évader, si tu excelles à



effectuer l’analyse des composants à développer à partir de l’analyse d’affaires effectuée et de l’architecture

développer des packages SSIS, écrire du code pour la tâche de script et la gestion des erreurs, gérer les processus de déploiement

écrire des requêtes SQL moyennement complexe à complexe

créer et planifier des jobs avec l’agent SQL Server

analyser et optimiser la performance SQL des différentes requêtes qui accèdent aux bases de données

écrire la documentation technique sur les composants développés

monitorer et au besoin reprendre les processus de chargement de données en partageant cette tâche avec les autres développeurs ETL






Tu peux retrouver ta liberté si



tu as le sens du service à la clientèle

tu es autonome

tu respectes tes engagements

tu as une bonne capacité d’analyse

tu as un esprit d’équipe

tu aimes bâtir sur le long terme

tu aimes apprendre

tu communiques facilement

tu aimes la diversité et le changement dans ton quotidien






Syntell en deux mots


Nous sommes une équipe de passionnés de la donnée et de nos clients! Nous livrons des produits et des services de grande qualité, tout en cherchant à garantir un avenir meilleur pour notre équipe. La collaboration entre tous les membres de notre équipe favorise le développement du plein potentiel de chacun. Notre organisation privilégie une gestion ouverte, participative et basée sur la confiance et où l’atteinte des résultats se fait par le travail d’équipe et la coopération.





Compétences recherchées






Compétences générales
 :


DEC en informatique ou autre formation pertinente

3 à 5 ans d’expérience dans le rôle de développeur ETL






Compétences techniques :



Maîtrise du langage SQL et des bases de données SQL Server (MS SQL Server 2016/2019)

Expérience dans l’analyse de performance et dans l’optimisation de requêtes SQL et dans le design de cube

Forte connaissance d’ETL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS (SQL Server Integration/Reporting Services)

Expérience de programmation avec des langages MDXConnaissance de Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)

Connaissance de l’approche « Kimball » ou « Data Vault » (atout)

Connaissance de C#/VB/PowerShell (atout)

Connaissance des BD Microsoft Azure (atout)

Expérience en analyse d'affaires (atout)

Connaissance de Power BI (atout)






Avantages sociaux



Rémunération compétitive

Horaire flexible

Remboursement d'activités de formation et perfectionnement

Assurance des frais médicaux et paramédicaux, assurance vie et invalidité longue durée et compte santé

Télétravail





Le succès de notre organisation repose sur l’énorme talent et la complémentarité de notre équipe. Nous avons confiance qu’ensemble, nous pouvons tout accomplir. C’est pourquoi le bien-être de nos collègues ainsi que leur développement font partie de nos priorités.

Si tu es enthousiaste et passionné.e de ton domaine d’expertise, nous serons enchantés de recevoir ta candidature. 


Fais-nous parvenir ton CV dès aujourd’hui à : emplois@syntell.com



Nous te remercions de ton intérêt!

Senior Software Engineer (Java)





Rocket Financial is an early-stage start-up in the Financial Technology space. Our mission is to change the way how money moves around the planet. Primarily, we are building a Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) platform for those wanting to integrate into the world financial infrastructure.




We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our engineering team. As part of a scrum team, you will have the opportunity to work collaboratively with the Product, UI/UX, and Customer Service teams to design, build, and test application components for the Rocket Financial platform. As a fast-growing start-up in the Fintech space, you will have significant ownership in your work and the chance to make use of diverse technologies to achieve the company objectives.




This role will report to the Team Lead.





RESPONSIBILITIES






Design, implement, and unit test Java-based applications and microservice components.

Participate in scrum processes.

Review and analyze requirements during sprint planning.

Create necessary design documentations.

Working with scrum team to come up with the best solutions.

Participate in code and design reviews.

Debugging and resolving technical problems that arise.

Assist with evaluation and testing of software products.

Provide technical guidance to more junior staff, and review and oversee their work.






QUALIFICATIONS






8+ years of Java development experience.

Experienced with JDK 8+, Spring Framework and other related technologies.

Experience in creating and implementing REST API in microservices components 

Experience with relational database, such as Postgres.

Experience with containers such as Docker.

Experience participating in design reviews and code reviews.

Experience working with CI/CD processes and tools such as Jenkins, Jira, etc.

Experience working with AWS cloud infrastructure.

Experience in troubleshooting production issues, analyzing thread/heap dumps.

Good working knowledge of Kafka, OAuth 2.0/OpenID Connect, and Kubernetes/Openshift.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Excellent time management and organizational skills.

Ability to keep current with the constantly changing technology industry.

The ideal candidate is a highly resourceful and innovative developer with extensive experience in the layout, design and coding of websites specifically in PHP format. You must also possess a strong knowledge of web application development using PHP programming language and MySQL Server databases. 

 


Responsibilities



Perform a mix of maintenance, enhancements, and new development as required

Work in a data analyst role and with business intelligence applications

Document features, technical specifications & infrastructure Responsibilities

Work cross-functionally to convert business needs into technical specifications






Qualifications



3+ years' of experience in web development and software design

Expertise in front-end technologies (HTML, JavaScript, CSS), PHP frameworks, and MySQL databases

Automotive background is a definite plus!

job_title: Senior Cloud Engineer, Scotia Digital (Vancouver Hub)
industries: Banking
description:
Requisition ID: 145028

At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.

We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.

If you’d like to learn more about our Digital Banking career opportunities, explore our Communities of Practice, or hear from our leaders, check out our Technology at Scotia career page.

Scotiabank has embarked on the journey to modernize both development practices and tools. One of the main areas of transformation is the public cloud and the various platform technologies that support both development and operations on the cloud. The aim is to provide a streamlined process and framework which will allow the development teams to focus on building business logic. We are looking to build our development team with influencer, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.


The Role


The role of the Senior Cloud Engineer operates within the Cloud Platform Engineering team. This valuable member of the team will be responsible for creating platform components and services for the broad enterprise use.


Is this role right for you? 



Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.

Key accountabilities include design, development and maintenance of cloud platforms, services, and components to enable safe enterprise-wide use of public cloud offerings

Technical ownership/leadership of a component of a larger product.

Designing, implementing, and refactoring code (typically Go, Python).

Ensuring software, programs and applications are developed and/or configured to meet high availability, integrity and reliability, security, and compliance requirements.

Working with other engineers and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks.

Working with application teams for successful onboarding onto the Platform

Participating in planning and retrospective sessions, attending stand-ups, etc.

Be able to build and operate the highly available and scalable software and infrastructure.




What You Will Bring To Succeed




At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with development languages (Go, Python)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with container-based virtualization technologies (Docker)

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience in the use of CI/CD Tools 

At least 3+ years of hands-on technical working experience with config management tools and Scripting Languages (Ansible, Bash, Groovy)

Superior oral and written communication skills

Expertise and understanding of Cloud Native Platforms, particularly Kubernetes, and associated technologies (e.g., Istio, Envoy, Anthos, Kustomize).

Experience working with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.

Knowledge of software design patterns, and/or security considerations 

Focus on scalable, enterprise-level software system design (both on code and infrastructure levels)


Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
CSC Generation
 is saving Retail. We acquire store and catalog based retailers, and transform them into high performing, “digital first” brands. In just four years, we’ve acquired and turned around brands including: Sur La Table, Z Gallerie, and One Kings Lane, saving over 2,000 jobs and reaching $1.7 billion in revenue. 




CSC Generation Engineering needs the best software engineers to support our team’s mission of improving the tech stack of our portfolio companies. We manage existing websites, while building cross product components and upgrading legacy stacks to cutting edge technologies. We work in cross-functional teams consisting of developers, QA and DevOps specialists, along with input from the Product team. The team strives to improve and develop portfolio companies' websites and shared components to make them faster and more successful. We are collaborative, with an emphasis on iteration and learning. We want someone who is excited to work with various tech in a fast-paced culture, wants to make an immediate impact, and is ready to rise to the challenge of a growing organization. Do you want every day to be a learning experience? Then keep reading! 





Our ideal candidate is someone that:



Can work on both frontend and backend components (if you're stronger in frontend or backend, we'd still like to hear from you) 

Is capable of being the technical owner of an internally facing consumer microservice product 

Has experience with our tech stack: Javascript, Node.js, React.js, AWS (ie: Lambda, ElastiCache, CloudFront, CodePipeline)

Believes in ownership throughout the entire software lifecycle, not only to the next handoff 

Believe in finding the best solution, not just one that works 






What's in it for you:



Competitive compensation packages with an option for equity for those that is important to, in a pre-IPO company (your choice)

Remote first - though we have an office in Toronto, we expect you to decide where you want to work








CSC Generation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

job_title: Sr Software Engineer:Edge Services, Core Infrastructure - Slack
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Products and Technology
 Job Details 



Sr. Software Engineer: Edge Services, Core Infrastructure





 Slack enables people all over the world to communicate and collaborate together. Teams of all sizes — from the world’s largest public companies to the smallest of startups — use Slack to get work done. We work at a tremendous scale, aiming for 5 9s of uptime for all services. 



 1M Slack messages sent per minute via the API 

 300M events per minute broadcast to Slack clients 

 90B database queries per day 

 6B background jobs enqueued per day 

 2T metrics collected per day 




Infrastructure at Slack






Our Team Maintains And Builds The Lower Levels Of Our Stack, Including




 We operate at tremendous scale with systems that process millions of events per second.


 Edge services 

 Data Stores and Caches 

 Real-time messaging and event fanout 

 Asynchronous background job processing 



 We’ve done our job correctly when none of our users think about us, much like a vital utility. We don’t typically ship new user-facing features, but rather ensure our systems are exceptionally performant, highly available, reliable, and scalable. In other words, we make Slack work seamlessly. Slack's backend services are written in Go and Java, and Slack's API is built on 
 PHP/Hack
 . Our 
 data infrastructure
 is built on Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark, and MySQL/Vitess. 





The Edge Services Team





 We are a small team building critical services that enable Slack to scale for our largest customers. Flannel, our edge cache, powers the most latency critical queries for our largest entities today. 



 We power core Slack functionality such as shared channels, our privacy-preserving image proxy, and many other key day-to-day parts of our customer’s experience. We have a strong commitment to quality and understand that simplicity and reliability are the foundations of our work. 



 We are actively building the future of edge caching at Slack, so we can support a growing number of customers without increasing complexity. 




If You Were To Join Slack, Here Are The Types Of Things You Would Do Over The Course Of a Typical Week




 Design, build, ship and maintain the Edge caching services that serves ~20% of all of Slack's API traffic and is critical to Slack’s core functionality. 

 Collaborate with peers in Engineering to triage bugs and fix sophisticated production issues across the stack related to our services. 

 Whiteboard a fix to a scaling or reliability problem, then make it happen. 

 Write, review, or provide feedback on a technical design proposal from other infrastructure teams. 




You may be a fit for this role if you:





 Have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field/ equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience. 

 Have built large-scale systems professionally for 4+ years and can point to things you’ve worked on. 

 Have built reliable, safe distributed systems and understand the engineering and product trade-offs, and how to make a case for either. 

 Work on complex issues where the analysis requires an in-depth knowledge of the company and existing architecture. 

 Love to model modern methodologies for unit tests, code review, design documentation, debugging, and troubleshooting. You've been developing and operating web applications professionally and can talk at length to things you and your teams have built 

 Are curious, inquisitive, and determined to fix things when they break. 




Bonus points





 Experience with AWS 

 Experience building and releasing software using Docker containers 

 Experience with Kubernetes 



 Edge Services is a diverse and inclusive team that is quickly growing and building the future of Slack’s infrastructure. We are happy to help you learn what you need to know; we encourage and support each other’s growth and it’s not expected that you would have expertise across all of these areas from the beginning. 



 Come join us! 


Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.

job_title: Sr Software Engineer:Edge Services, Core Infrastructure - Slack
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Products and Technology
 Job Details 



Sr. Software Engineer: Edge Services, Core Infrastructure





 Slack enables people all over the world to communicate and collaborate together. Teams of all sizes — from the world’s largest public companies to the smallest of startups — use Slack to get work done. We work at a tremendous scale, aiming for 5 9s of uptime for all services. 



 1M Slack messages sent per minute via the API 

 300M events per minute broadcast to Slack clients 

 90B database queries per day 

 6B background jobs enqueued per day 

 2T metrics collected per day 




Infrastructure at Slack






Our Team Maintains And Builds The Lower Levels Of Our Stack, Including




 We operate at tremendous scale with systems that process millions of events per second.


 Edge services 

 Data Stores and Caches 

 Real-time messaging and event fanout 

 Asynchronous background job processing 



 We’ve done our job correctly when none of our users think about us, much like a vital utility. We don’t typically ship new user-facing features, but rather ensure our systems are exceptionally performant, highly available, reliable, and scalable. In other words, we make Slack work seamlessly. Slack's backend services are written in Go and Java, and Slack's API is built on 
 PHP/Hack
 . Our 
 data infrastructure
 is built on Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Spark, and MySQL/Vitess. 





The Edge Services Team





 We are a small team building critical services that enable Slack to scale for our largest customers. Flannel, our edge cache, powers the most latency critical queries for our largest entities today. 



 We power core Slack functionality such as shared channels, our privacy-preserving image proxy, and many other key day-to-day parts of our customer’s experience. We have a strong commitment to quality and understand that simplicity and reliability are the foundations of our work. 



 We are actively building the future of edge caching at Slack, so we can support a growing number of customers without increasing complexity. 




If You Were To Join Slack, Here Are The Types Of Things You Would Do Over The Course Of a Typical Week




 Design, build, ship and maintain the Edge caching services that serves ~20% of all of Slack's API traffic and is critical to Slack’s core functionality. 

 Collaborate with peers in Engineering to triage bugs and fix sophisticated production issues across the stack related to our services. 

 Whiteboard a fix to a scaling or reliability problem, then make it happen. 

 Write, review, or provide feedback on a technical design proposal from other infrastructure teams. 




You may be a fit for this role if you:





 Have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field/ equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience. 

 Have built large-scale systems professionally for 4+ years and can point to things you’ve worked on. 

 Have built reliable, safe distributed systems and understand the engineering and product trade-offs, and how to make a case for either. 

 Work on complex issues where the analysis requires an in-depth knowledge of the company and existing architecture. 

 Love to model modern methodologies for unit tests, code review, design documentation, debugging, and troubleshooting. You've been developing and operating web applications professionally and can talk at length to things you and your teams have built 

 Are curious, inquisitive, and determined to fix things when they break. 




Bonus points





 Experience with AWS 

 Experience building and releasing software using Docker containers 

 Experience with Kubernetes 



 Edge Services is a diverse and inclusive team that is quickly growing and building the future of Slack’s infrastructure. We are happy to help you learn what you need to know; we encourage and support each other’s growth and it’s not expected that you would have expertise across all of these areas from the beginning. 



 Come join us! 


Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?

Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today’s most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more. We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Facebook's products to ship new solutions that address partners’ opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners’ success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Facebook family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms. As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it’s like being the engineering lead in a startup. Role Types:We have a few different role types available in Partner Engineering depending on your interests and skill sets as follows: Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Facebook achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.Systems & Tools Engineer: This role is primarily coding on internal systems & tools to help us operate more efficiently in Partnerships and deliver more value to our partners. There is a range of projects including partner management systems and tools, video/news/music content management systems, API/platform management and much more.-------Notre équipe, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, est à la recherche d'ingénieurs axés sur l'impact et l'esprit d'entreprise, prêts à apporter leurs idées et à faire la différence. Nous appliquons nos compétences en ingénierie et notre sens des affaires pour résoudre des problèmes à l'intersection des affaires et de l'innovation dans de nombreux secteurs et produits comptant parmi les plus passionnants du moment. Il s'agit notamment de Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Jeux, Workplace, IA et bien d'autres. Nous sommes des ingénieurs, et nous écrivons du code évolutif et performant sur l'ensemble des produits Facebook pour expédier de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux opportunités et aux défis des partenaires. Nous concevons et fournissons également des solutions techniques essentielles à la réussite de nos partenaires. Ce faisant, nous aidons nos partenaires à tirer le meilleur parti de leur collaboration avec la famille d'applications Facebook en les aidant à développer leurs activités avec nous tout en réduisant les efforts et les investissements nécessaires pour exploiter nos plateformes. En tant qu'ingénieur partenaire, vous aurez l'occasion de voir l'impact commercial des solutions que vous construisez avec nos partenaires. Vous aurez l'occasion d'apprendre et de construire sur différentes piles technologiques et différents langages. Vous utiliserez votre passion pour l'entrepreneuriat et la liberté que vous offre ce poste pour créer vos propres opportunités et choisir la manière dont vous aurez un impact. En bref, c'est comme être l'ingénieur en chef d'une startup. Types de postes :Nous avons plusieurs types de postes disponibles dans l'ingénierie des associés/associées, en fonction de vos intérêts et de vos compétences : Ingénieur associé/associée : Ce poste consiste à passer du temps avec les associés/associées pour comprendre leurs besoins techniques et commerciaux, puis à coder des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins. Ce codage peut prendre la forme d'API, d'intégrations de produits ou d'outils pour aider les partenaires et Facebook à atteindre des résultats mutuellement bénéfiques.Ingénieur des systèmes et outils : Ce poste consiste principalement à coder des systèmes et des outils internes pour nous aider à fonctionner plus efficacement dans les partenariats et à offrir plus de valeur à nos partenaires. Il existe une gamme de projets comprenant des systèmes et des outils de gestion des partenaires, des systèmes de gestion du contenu vidéo/nouvelles/musique, la gestion des API/plateformes et bien plus encore.

Partner Engineer | Ingénieur associé/associée Responsibilities:



Deeply understand Facebook apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation | Comprendre en profondeur les applications et produits Facebook (par exemple, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, vidéo, jeux, paiements) et leur mise en œuvre sous-jacente

Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code | Rédiger et expédier du code fiable, évolutif et efficace

Be a subject matter expert in relevant project/product and technology areas. Build and improve solutions in collaboration with engineering, product, and cross functional partners | Être un expert en la matière dans les domaines pertinents du projet/produit et de la technologie. Construire et améliorer des solutions en collaboration avec l'ingénierie, le produit et les associés/associées transversaux/transversales

Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners | Identifier et faire émerger des idées en utilisant des statistiques sur l'utilisation du produit pour augmenter l'adoption et fournir de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux besoins de nos partenaires

Use broad range of technical and soft skills to build productive relationships with our partners, and independently resolve complex technical and business needs while contributing to partner documentation | Utiliser un large éventail de compétences techniques et non techniques pour établir des relations productives avec nos associés/associées, et résoudre de manière indépendante des besoins techniques et commerciaux complexes tout en contribuant à la documentation des associés/associées

Use expertise and product insight to deliver high-quality project/integration/partner engagements, while influencing product roadmap to meet the business needs | Utiliser l'expertise et la connaissance des produits pour fournir des engagements de qualité en matière de projets, d'intégration et de partenariat, tout en influençant la feuille de route des produits pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise

Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions | Guider les changements de flux de travail et obtenir le consensus des parties prenantes tout en recherchant des solutions

Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders | Répondre et maintenir une communication efficace avec les partenaires industriels et les parties prenantes internes

Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Facebook’s platform products and ensure value creation | Travailler avec les partenaires pour développer un plan stratégique à long terme, fondé sur les objectifs commerciaux, et gérer les partenaires pendant les intégrations avec les produits de la plateforme Facebook et assurer la création de valeur

Represent Facebook and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8 | Représenter Facebook et ses produits, les API et outils lors de réunions d’associés/associées et d'événements industriels, notamment le F8

Understand organizational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed | Comprendre la structure organisationnelle et la dynamique des équipes interfonctionnelles et être capable d'obtenir le soutien de ces équipes si nécessaire

Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team | Construire et gérer de solides relations de travail avec les homologues techniques. Assurer le mentorat et partager les connaissances avec ses pairs, en créant une atmosphère positive au sein de l'équipe

Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time | Volonté de voyager environ 20 % du temps



Minimum Qualifications:



4+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience | Plus de 4 ans d'expérience en tant qu'ingénieur logiciel pour la création et la livraison de produits ou une expérience équivalente

B.A./B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent degree or experience | B.A./B.S. ou M.S. en informatique ou diplôme ou expérience équivalente

Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin or C# | Expérience des langages open source tels que PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin ou C#

Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) | Connaissance de la pile technologique Web (par exemple HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)

Experience with software design and architecture | Expérience en matière de conception et d'architecture de logiciels

Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences | Expérience en matière de communication de concepts techniques à des publics non techniques



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with REST APIs and developer platforms | Expérience des API REST et des plateformes de développement

Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects | Expérience de travail sur des bases de code multi-personnes, y compris des projets open source ou personnels

Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects) | Expérience des contributions open source (notamment dans le cadre de projets plus importants)

Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation | Expérience en matière de contribution à la documentation des développeurs et des plateformes

Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred | L’expérience en matière de contact avec les clients/partenaires et/ou de communication avec un public est préférable

Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP | Expérience en matière de travail avec des plateformes d’informatique en nuage telles que AWS, GCP

industries: Accounting
description:
What is the opportunity?

RBC Business Financial Services - Technology & Operations software developers build the next-generation technologies that change how millions of people interact with financial information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond traditional banking.

The RBC Business Financial Services team offers the opportunity to leverage our new large scale transformation program to develop innovative solutions to our most challenging problems for RBC's commercial banking customers. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on tough challenges and make an impact to millions of Canadians and businesses every day.

As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to RBC's needs with opportunities to switch projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve with our customer's needs. We need our developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we push forward.

What will you do?


 Design and develop state of the art business solutions utilizing the latest technology stack

 Maximize code reusability while also considering design, deployment and testability

 Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes

 Develop and maintain APIs and all supporting code - design and build micro-services

 Actively participate and provide technical expertise for the creation, implementation and ongoing evolution of RBC's design and development methodologies, coding standards and style guidelines

 Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability - design highly scalable and extensible products


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


 2-3 years' experience with Angular 2+, Java 8, REST API/Micro services, Spring Framework (MVC, Security, JPA, Boot) Maven, SQL

 Experience in designing applications running on Cloud platforms such as PCF, Bluemix, AWS

 Experience with modern Web UI frameworks

 Strong experience with Micro Services development with REST API design best practices

 Design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using latest Java and JavaScript technologies.

 Employ agile development practices including test and deployment automation as well as Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery using DevOps tools to improve overall execution speed and product quality


Nice-to-have


 Experience building software for the financial services industry - banking, insurance or investments

 Experience in developing accessible technologies

 Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 Opportunities to do challenging work

 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies


Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

job_title: UI Software Developer Co-op Intern – Undergraduate
industries: Software Development and Computer and Network Security
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!


We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.



The Role


We are looking for co-op students to work alongside our seasoned developers in our downtown Toronto office (Remote until office re-opens). This position is to join the UI team responsible for our cloud-based Proofpoint Email Archive, a software-as-a-service solution featuring an advanced service-oriented architecture with distributed grid search and large-scale storage infrastructure to meet the demanding needs of thousands of users from among the largest businesses in the world. You will spend the co-op work term on projects alongside talented, experienced professionals, gain practical experience in an agile software development environment and get a chance to see what it is like to work for a dynamic, NASDAQ-listed company.

The ideal candidate is someone who is agile and who quickly comes up to speed in a fast-paced technical environment and can adapt to new technologies rapidly. You should be interested in web development, working with modern web technologies and building great user interfaces to become a knowledgeable web developer.



Job Requirements




Experience with web technologies i.e. HTML, CSS, JavaScript

Understanding of OO concepts/methodologies

Experience with UNIX/Linux, Windows/.NET

Passion for learning inquiry and problem solving

Excellent written and verbal communication skills


It's a plus if you have these skills


Database skills

JUnit/ NUnit frameworks

MS Exchange and Active Directory

Web services (REST/SOAP)



Candidate Profile


You have the ability and interest in working 
full time
 (a maximum of 
37.5
 hours/week) in our Toronto office or remotely until it is safe to work in office. You are currently pursuing an 
undergraduate degree 
and are successfully maintaining an above average GPA. This internship is scheduled to start in May 2022 and run through August 2023.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Join our team!






Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together:


 


Unlock the power of cloud-native environments, having the freedom to leverage innovative technologies and the latest standards.

Help drive a high-performance Developer culture.

Become a go-to expert on the code components under your responsibility and how they fit into the overall architecture, promoting a seamless solution.

Power future possibilities for our customers and advance a compelling portfolio of technologies and services.






Here's how:


 


Design and build simple, efficient and maintainable cloud-based microservices, adopting standard components and libraries whenever possible.

Take responsibility for your components.

Integrate security into all daily efforts, including secure design and coding practices.

Collaborate to identify efficient architectures.

Estimate the effort needed to execute your tasks and support your leads in creating unified and reliable delivery plans.


 


Qualifications


 


You're the missing piece of the puzzle! 






7+ years of experience with JAVA.

2 years experience with microServices based architecture.

2 years working on an application deployed on GCP.

2 years working in Agile methodologies.

2 years working on an application deployed via CI/CD pipeline.

Secure design and coding practices.

Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams.

A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity.

Bachelors in Computer Science.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
525604BR


Introduction


*Based out of Ottawa office *

Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.


Your Role and Responsibilities


As a IBM Security Cloud/Automation Developer, you will be expected to demonstrate solid conceptual and technical skills as you develop, implement, and eventually help to run core infrastructure components to back IBM Cloud Pak® for Security



 You will be working with Docker containers, Docker Compose for multi-container applications, YAML files to configure your application’s services, Kubernetes for container-orchestration system, and the OpenShift Container Platform developed by Red Hat.





You will work with product owners and customer stakeholders to implement new components, and new features in existing components. You will contribute to new features and help your team find and resolve technical debt using agile development practices.



 You will help your team support and run your services in production in a DevOps oriented fashion.

 You will work with other products and teams in the IBM Security division to help them utilize and develop against the platform components you build.



**Based out of Ottawa office **


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Experience in agile software development methodologies

5+ years of professional experience developing in one or more popular programming languages like Java, Golang, C++.

Experience developing in multi-container applications

Experience with Continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) pipeline

Experience with RESTful APIs and web services for cloud architecture development

Experience with Database development

Experience with Kafka streaming system like Apache Kafka, Strimiz.

Willingness to take ownership of your code – you build it, you run it

Ability to work with others locally, remotely, and geographically dispersed




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Experience in the following technologies: Docker, Docker Compose, Kubernetes, and OpenShift

Experience in ReactiveX programming Java

Experience in automated testing frameworks



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Our team is all about performance. We love using the latest technologies and tools for making our apps as performant, stable, and available as possible. We work at all layers of our applications, from the networking stack and other core infrastructure under the hood to UI changes and product features that are front and center. On the iOS Performance team you have the opportunity to have significant ownership of and impact on the performance and quality of our mobile applications that hundreds of millions of people love to use.


What You'll Do 


As part of the team you'll be responsible for using your creativity, excellent problem solving, and technical skills to enable Twitter for iOS to reach our next billion global users. You will collaborate closely with other highly motivated and wonderful client engineers, backend engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers. You will use your in-depth knowledge of all things iOS and performance to craft features and infrastructure that


Improve measured and perceived performance

Increase the quality of our apps on less performant devices and lower quality networks

Reach Twitter users around the world


The work you drive will play a key role in Twitter user satisfaction and growth. Existing customers will immediately benefit from this work, and many more new customers worldwide will follow. You will empower people across the globe to connect and communicate.



Who You Are



You’re an experienced mobile engineer looking to make Twitter's iOS apps the best mobile experiences out there. You're someone who excels at user-centric product development and has a passion for making beautiful, smooth, and delightful mobile experiences. You care deeply about performance, you're experienced with the tools of the trade, you're comfortable digging into the nitty-gritty, and you’re eager to have an impact at a global scale.

Ideally, you have experience with


Top-notch programming skills in languages like Swift and Objective-C

Xcode performance measurement and debugging tools

General networking knowledge with detailed experience in iOS networking stacks

Implementing new features and optimizing existing ones

Technical depth that allows you to rapidly fix bugs and solve problems

Working closely across a variety of teams including product management, design, and engineering

Knowledge of core engineering concepts such as common data structures, algorithms, profiling, and testing




Qualifications




4+ years experience developing previous iOS applications or working on non-mobile performance problems

4+ years experience with Swift or Objective-C

BS, MS, or PhD in computer science or a related field, or equivalent work experience

Responsibilities: 

1. Work independently, or in a group under the direction of a team lead, fixing security vulnerabilities and optimizing code, primarily on the requested development platform in C and C++. 

2. Follow coding standards and recommendations provided by the code scanning tools.

3. Conduct code reviews.

4. Cooperate with quality assurance in defining test cases.

5. Write module tests as part of the feature development.

6. Document work and regularly report to the manager.

7. Actively participate in project and scrum meetings.




Qualifications:

1. 7+ years of professional experience.

2. Solid knowledge of the C and C++ languages is a must.

3. Familiarity with Microsoft Visual Studio and Linux build and debug tools.

4. Productivity in development, troubleshooting and debugging skills.

5. Good communications and relationships with other developers and the QA team

6. Ability to quickly learn, efficiently and flexibly work with various technologies in heterogeneous environments.

7. Working experience with wide range of technologies, such as C++, JS, Node.js.




Preferred Skills:

1. Familiarity with security scanning tools (Veracode, SonarQube, CodeQL).

2. Familiarity with Agile methodologies and the tools.

3. Familiarity with build and source control systems – GitLab, CI/CD, ADO.

4. Familiarity with defect tracking systems, e.g. Jira.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Apex Systems is a global IT services provider and our staffing practice has an opening for a API Developer with experience building APIs in a cloud environment, Node.JS/Java development experience, and knowledge of building CI/CD pipelines to place at our client, a top Financial Institution.


Terms: 
6-month contract-to-hire


Start Date
: Immediately! COVID-19 accommodated


Location:
 Yonge and Sheppard (currently 100% work from home, future on site requirement post COVID-19)


Application Process:
 It is best to apply via the medium on which you are seeing this posting. If you encounter technical difficulties submitting your resume, please send your resume in Word format to Phil Piche at ppiche@apexsystems.com and reference API Developer


Responsibilities:



Implements initiatives as required to deliver business objective related to development in cloud (i.e. AWS) environment 

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment along side Lead Developers/BAs

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

Reviews the work of other team members as required.

Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.

Designs API prototypes using Node.JS programming

Devises new prototypes for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with serverless architectural patterns.

Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness specific to API development

Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.

Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.




Key Qualifications:
 

Clear understanding of API Development concepts, SOA architecture, and their application in solution building. 

Comprehensive understanding and skills for implementing API Service with: Web Services using REST/JSON/Swagger and SOAP/WSDL


Security implementation using API Key, OAuth2, JWT/JWS/JWE, OpenID Connect, Lambda authorizers, LDAP, etc.

AWS cloud development technologies like Lambda using node.js, java; API Gateway; Cloud Pipeline; Security etc.

IBM API Connect (nice to have)


Experience with DevOp tools, like BitBucket (git), Bamboo, Artifactory, Ansible.

Programming languages (JavaScript with Node.js, SQL, Shell scripts etc.), Databases (MySQL, No SQL Databases like MongoDB)


(bonus) Experience with multiple middleware technologies (Application Servers, BPMS, ESB & Message Brokers etc.)


Effective communication and documentation skills ensuring that customers and teams have a clear understanding of solutions recommended and intended outcomes.

Demonstrate leadership skills of leading projects, coordinating work effort among teams, triaging production issues and etc.



EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
The engineering team at Ritual is a small and tight-knit unit. We are driven to deliver high-quality software as quickly as possible to our end users. We are extremely data-driven in our decisions about the product and constantly iterate to provide the best customer experience. We are problem solvers, while remaining business-minded and customer-focused.




We are mostly a Java shop hosted on Google Cloud Platform with most of our services in Kubernetes. Our data layer is mainly in MySQL and Redis. Our customers interact with the application through native iOS and Android apps as well as a web interface (React). We take a project-based agile approach to software development. We use Grafana, Stackdriver, and PagerDuty for our monitoring and alerting. We use Bazel as the build system for our backend services, along with Jenkins and Python for our CI/CD and automation tooling.




This role is a Site Reliability Engineer with a focus on cloud infrastructure for Kubernetes services. Your typical day involves working with the infrastructure team to solve complex issues around system reliability, operations, and deployment.





As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Ritual….





You will help us design and build scalable and reliable services to support our growing business. We are looking for someone with a passion for developing mission-critical software that creates simple abstractions for complex infrastructure. If you are passionate about scalability and performance, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and are excited to learn, we’d like to talk to you.

Technical leadership at Ritual requires impact and ownership. A senior site reliability engineer at Ritual is expected to be effective in the following areas:



Contribute to architecture.
 You understand large areas of our system and are able to reuse or add new components to existing architecture. You have a passion for the latest cloud technologies.


Scalability and performance.
 You are always mindful of scalability and demonstrate a meaningful understanding of scalable design and performance choices.


From requirement to delivery.
 You work independently or as part of a team that can quickly turn requirements into testable production ready code.


Post Delivery.
 You have a good knowledge of our deployment pipelines. You stay accountable for the deployment after going live into production; always looking into improving our processes around pushing releases to production. You are proactive in monitoring/alerting of the services you own and are always passionate about observability of our system.


Code quality & code review.
 You have passion for quality code and maintain a high standard of style; enforce/update existing patterns


Team oriented.
 You build tools that make the whole team more productive. Improve tools and processes when needed.


Knowledge transfer & mentorship.
 You share the knowledge you've gathered and help the rest of the team grow






We’re looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer that has…






BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience

6+ years of experience as a site reliability engineer, infrastructure engineer, or cloud security engineer

Experience working with Infrastructure-as-Code and managing cloud environments

Experience with cloud observability and monitoring services

Experience in writing CI/CD pipelines and automation tooling

Operational experience with Kubernetes or container orchestration systems

Preference for experience with database design and SQL






Bonus points for…






Experience developing software in a high-level programming language such as Java/Python/Go/Groovy

Applied knowledge of security best practices in cloud environments

Being the security advocate for improvements on the SRE/Cloud infrastructure team

Linux system administration and networking

Large systems software design experience

A Github account with cool projects in it






Who you’ll work with:





Reza Manbachi, Director of Software Engineering

Stephen Dong, Sr. Software Engineer

Adrian Gudas, Sr. Site Reliability Engineer

Mo Adi, Staff Backend Engineer





What we offer:






Contribute to a lifestyle-changing consumer product used worldwide

Ritual credits to spend anywhere

Healthcare coverage from day one, and a flexible vacation policy (Need time? Take time)

Equity in the business - ownership is a key value at Ritual and we want you to share in our long-term success

Be at the heart of the growth startup community

Work with truly elite peers in a super-fun office (remotely for now!)






About Ritual:



 


Ritual delivers more than just an avenue to skip the lunch line - we serve up a true community experience, helping you connect with your social circle and local businesses via seamless technology, all built around what humans love most - food. Founded in 2014 by three serial entrepreneurs, we’re about a seamless ordering process, helping you discover hidden gems in your community, and connecting with your peers through seamless ordering. We help small businesses thrive in a digital culture with the ease and convenience of push button ordering, while retaining the human connection that makes local shops special. We believe we’re making a positive cultural impact on a global scale - and our investors do, too: we’ve raised over $140M in funding, helping us bring Ritual to nearly 50 cities across North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. Hungry for more? Visit us at https://ritual.co/





Ritual fosters and welcomes diverse teams and ideas: ideas that are new, different, and game-changing. We constantly strive to live up to our core values of authenticity, open-mindedness, and focusing on impact. We aim to build a culture where difference is valued, every team member has a seat at the table, and all voices are heard. It is thus our mission to attract and cultivate diverse perspectives by empowering our people to bring their authentic selves to work every day. 






We are committed to continuous improvement, and a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates engaging in Ritual’s selection and interviewing process.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Come be part of a team that will directly shape and influence the future growth of Amazon. The Compensation and Recruiter Experience (CORE) team is responsible for delivering an industry leading candidate experience; developing, building, and innovating, global, scalable technology recruiting solutions that are both powerful and light-weight. This team and technologies are a critical component in Amazon’s continued growth and launching of new products and services.

You will contribute to all aspects of the software development lifecycle including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. As a part of the CORE team, you will deliver robust feature sets, intuitive designs, and user interfaces that make it easy for Amazonians to excel at recruiting the top talent in the world.



You Will



As a software development engineer on the team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the definition, vision, design, roadmap and development of product features from beginning to end.


 Work with the team to help drive business decisions

 Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain innovative software solutions to transform service performance, durability, cost, and security.

 Use software engineering best practices to ensure a high standard of quality for all of the team deliverables

 Write high quality distributed system software

 Work in an agile, startup-like development environment, where you are always working on the most important stuff.





Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience




Preferred Qualifications




 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (or related discipline) and/or equivalent training & work experience

 Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

 Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

 Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

 Experience creating highly-scalable web or desktop applications.

 6+ years professional experience in software development

 Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

 Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems

 Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between.

 Experience with React or other JavaScript frameworks (Angular etc.).


By submitting your application here, you can apply once to be considered for multiple Software Engineer openings across various Amazon teams. If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

Amazon is committed to providing accommodations at all stages through recruitment and employment in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity, advise Human Resources if you require accommodation, including in order to apply for a position.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC
