industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

As a Senior Web Developer at Elastic on the Marketing web development team, you'll be working collaboratively in a distributed working environment delivering valuable features for our web infrastructure that powers elastic.co. Elastic.co is our primary channel to communicate with potential and existing customers on how the power of search can solve their biggest challenges. We support stakeholders across the company and are working to facilitate a high quality customer experience at scale. We’re seeking a talented web developer and communicator to help push the our webteam and team to new heights.



What You Will Be Doing




You will be working on the application and backend layer that powers our flagship website, elastic.co. You will be working on enhancing our resiliency, introducing new functionality, and collaborating with engineering teams across the company to ensure we are delivering a first-class experience to our customers. 

You will collaborate with and mentor international teammates in a mostly text-based, asynchronous, remote-first team environment with occasional video calls and yearly conferences. You’ll be hands-on with the team and codebase, reviewing work, and providing constructive feedback.

You will help define the team’s overall technical strategy, collaborating on a product roadmap, and then breaking it into technical deliverables. You’ll act as an important and communicative part of an engaged and spirited team.



Our Team Style



We appreciate articulate and “humble people who want to grow as part of a team.

We welcome diversity in all forms. We embrace strange and risky ideas and appreciate characters of all sorts.

We hold each other accountable and work to a high standard. We take pride in the frequent, safe, and graceful delivery of innovative and valuable features.

We embrace open communication and challenge. We appreciate positivity and vigilance and strive for autonomy, trust, and personal and professional growth.


Our web application stack is primarily in Node.js, Next.js, with integrations to various platforms, both first and third party.





What You Will Bring




Previous experience building production web applications at scale, taking thorny problems and crafting high quality, working software solutions to them.

Experience in fullstack web development and managing infrastructure to support high availability, security, and scalability. 

Excellent practical judgement. You know how to prioritize, when to collaborate and ask for help, and when to be independent.

Measured and articulate written and spoken communication skills. You work well with others and can craft concise and expressive thoughts into correspondence: issues, investigations, documentation, and onboarding material.

An interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows, and philosophies that can help you grow. You can function well in an environment that drives towards change.


If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you! Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code samples, blog posts and writing samples, links to personal projects, etc.



Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People



As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.


Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary 

Health coverage for you and your family in many locations

Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles

Generous number of vacation days each year

Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)

Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love

Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

 ABOUT FLO | ADDÉNERGIE 


AddÉnergie is an integrated operator of electric vehicle charging stations and a leading provider of intelligent charging software and equipment in North America. Each month, AddÉnergie and its FLO network enable approximately half a million charging sessions and the transfer of 5.5 GWh of electricity, through more than 35,000 premium charging stations deployed on public networks, as well as commercial and residential installations. AddÉnergie's head office and network operations center are located in Quebec City, while the assembly plant is in Shawinigan. The company also has a regional office in Montreal and regional teams based in Ontario, British Columbia, California, New York and Florida. For more information, visit flo.com.


 ADVANTAGES OF WORKING AT ADDÉNERGIE 


Telecommuting

Varied and stimulating projects

Flexible schedules

Group insurance

Rechargeable leave in addition to vacation time!

To learn more about AddÉnergie and FLO, follow us on LinkedIn!

description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.


Niveau d'emploi


NV-10

Précurseur de nouvelles tendances technologiques au Canada, Desjardins cherche toujours à moderniser ses façons de faire. Es-tu prêt à relever le défi ?

Ta volonté de participer à fournir des solutions logicielles en tant que développeur/développeuse est un élément clé. Tu participes aux développements et évolutions de solutions d'affaires, tu réponds aux besoins de nos membres et clients, tu t’assures de la qualité et de la sécurité des solutions que tu codes. Membre d'une équipe, tu participes à la livraison continue de solutions, à leur maintien et à leur mise à jour. Tu es amené à collaborer régulièrement avec d'autres équipes. Tu es en mesure de prendre les décisions techniques et en assumer l’imputabilité. Ton leadership, tes habiletés relationnelles ainsi que ton expérience des pratiques DevOps, CI/CD et Agile te permettent de livrer des produits stables, de constamment améliorer leur qualité et trouver des solutions.

Tu auras l’opportunité de partager tes expériences à une communauté de pratique des développeurs.

Le mandat de la Direction Solutions Transversales Membres et Clients (DSTMC) consiste au développement et de l'intégration de solutions d'envergure -projets majeurs- mouvement pour les membres-clients (M-C). Plus spécifiquement, sous la responsabilité de la VP Analytique membres et clients et du Chef des données (CDO), nos deux projets: Unicité et Consentement M-C font partie du programme Données et analytique mouvement.

En utilisant des outils de MDM (Master Data Management) en combinaison avec le développement de micros-services, le but du projet Unicité M-C est de mettre en place un service de données transverses permettant d’identifier de façon unique et fiable, tous les M-C actuels et futurs, et ce une seule fois, quel que soit les produits et les services qu’ils consomment dans le Mouvement.


Responsabilités principales



Coacher plusieurs équipes dans l'application des technologies pour le développement des solutions d'affaires et la faire progresser dans le but d'améliorer la vélocité de livraison.

Identifier et prioriser des projets conjuguant affaires et technologies et soutenant les stratégies d’affaires.

Assurer l’analyse et le développement de produits logiciels, la conception, le code, les tests et l’exploitation en appliquant les bonnes pratiques de développement, de données et de sécurité.

Définir les méthodes de développement, patrons de développement, choix de technologies et les partager à travers les équipes que tu chapeautes.

Travailler en cocréation avec les partenaires d’affaires pour bien comprendre et ainsi réaliser l’arrimage des solutions représentant les intentions et objectifs d’affaires.

Assurer l’automatisation des essais (maîtriser les méthodologies associées ; ex :pyramides des essais, TDD, BDD ...) et se porter imputable de la qualité.

Assurer l’analyse et la résolution des incidents majeurs et être en leadership dans la résolution de problèmes hautement complexes.

Représenter les équipes de différents membres de la haute direction et auprès de partenaires ou d’organisme externes.

Se maintenir aux faits des tendances technologiques et pratiques de développement, et agir en tant que mentor auprès de l'équipe de développement au niveau des technologies et des façons de faire.

Établir des encadrements et documenter les solutions techniques et les pratiques pour assurer la pérennité des produits. 



Savoir-être



Faire preuve de leadership. Avoir un grand sens des responsabilités.

Posséder des capacités de communication hors pair et être capable de vulgariser des concepts compliqués 

Être capable d’influencer l’équipe vis-à-vis des meilleures façons de faire de l’industrie, ainsi que les autres personnes avec qui il interagit

Être curieux, savoir se remettre en question et déployer des efforts pour apprendre de nouvelles choses

Stimuler l'innovation 

Capacité d’apprentissage en continu

Être organisé, rigoureux et savoir gérer les priorités

Capacité à anticiper les problèmes et bloquants et trouver des façons proactives de les contourner. 

Capacité de comprendre rapidement, de s’adapter et d’anticiper



Savoir-faire



Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée

Un minimum de six ans d’expérience en développement web ou toute autre expérience pertinente

Expérience du domaine bancaire et/ou chez Desjardins (un atout)



Conditions particulières



Lieu de travail : Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride 

Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1



Connaissances spécifiques



Connaissance d'environnements web Java (JSP, J2EE, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, etc.) et des divers frameworks de développement (Spring MVC, Spring Security, etc.)

Connaissance d'Apache Kafka (un atout)

Connaissance des bases de données (Oracle, DB2) et du langage SQL 

Connaissance des concepts de services REST 

Connaissance d'outils de support au développement (GIT, MAVEN, JENKINS, JIRA, etc.)

Connaissance technique du Portail Desjardins, des applications AccèsD (Particulier et Affaires), et de l'environnement technologique Desjardins

Connaissance du concept infonuagique

Connaissance du PAAS

Connaissance de Cucumber

Connaissance de projets de développement en mode Agile



Compétences transversales Desjardins


Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action


Compétences clés au profil recherché


Gérer la complexité, Maîtriser la technologie, Planifier et coordonner


Lieu de travail


Complexe Desjardins Montréal


Syndicat


Non Syndiqué


Date de fin d'affichage


2022-03-20


Famille d'emplois


Technologies de l'information (GF)

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Description:*

Seeking a Sr. Software Developer for a long-term on-going contract / contract-to-perm mandate. As a result of new long-term developments and existing projects/work, there is a high likelihood that the contract will be extended or that the position will become permanent based on performance.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: Developing a module using Xavier and NVIDIA processors boards. In phase 1, we are doing engineering and development of units to deliver to the customer. Next phase would be to enhance software and hardware design. This is for a Video-based system that captures and manipulates data.

JOB DUTIES:


Perform embedded software development, Linux kernel and device driver development activities

Perform development using C, C++, and Python

Skills:*



c/c++, firmware, c, kernel, Embedded c, Linux kernel, Multithreading, embedded software, c++, Python, Vxworks, rtos, Linux


Top Skills Details:*



c/c++,firmware,c,kernel


Additional Skills & Qualifications:*



MUST HAVE #1: 5-10 years of experience in embedded software and driver-level development on Linux based systems MUST HAVE #2: Expert level experience in low-level software development using C, C++, Python MUST HAVE #3: Core experience in Linux kernel build system (build automation, Perl, Python, Shell scripts, makefiles) Nice to haves:


Experience with RTOS (VxWorks)

Experience with Safety-critical products

Experience with MIL STD or DO-178

Experience with Embedded Linux based SOC (System on Chip), XILINX (AMD)/NVIDIA Jetson platforms ( CUDA, NVIDIA Jetson APU's, Networking protocols, DisplayPort, GPU)

Constructing GNU scripts

Development experience in software multi-threaded environments

Experience in high-performance/speed video processing/capturing and video streaming

Embedded Software Security and Cryptography

Experience in accelerated data packet processing/streaming (DPDK, GPU Direct, Direct GMA)

Experience with Windows

Experience Level:*



Expert Level

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



Are you ready to pursue some of the hardest scalability, performance, and distributed computing challenges in AWS? Our team's vision is to be the world's authoritative provider of AWS computing insight, where customers can understand, control and optimize usage of AWS products. Because we sit at the nexus of all AWS services and interact directly with end-customers, we build relationships with teams across AWS to ensure that we offer a secure and reliable customer experience. We take inputs from these services and merge them with the millions of events every second to produce actionable insight to our customers.

Providing a scalable platform to support AWS’ expanding business is a complex architectural challenge, and accurate cost and usage information is a critical piece. Enterprise-level customers make large dollar-value decisions based on the timeliness, accuracy, and detail of the data provided by our products.

You will take on architectural challenges in making billions of usage records available for various customers and their use cases. You will be empowered to think big, invent on behalf of our customers, make judgment calls and find elegant solutions to hard problems. The AWS Insights is changing fast and this is a dynamic role where you will both learn and grow while you contribute to our success.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. This position involves on-call responsibilities, typically for one week every two months. We don’t like getting paged in the middle of the night or on the weekend, so we work to ensure that our systems are fault tolerant. When we do get paged, we work together to resolve the root cause so that we don’t get paged for the same issue twice.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.



Position Responsibilities




 Collaborate in the design, implementation, and deployment of successful internet-scale systems and services in support of our commerce operations and the businesses they support.

 Help define our secure, scalable, distributed and event-driven systems.

 Work with extraordinary teams delivering demanding projects.

 Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

 Understand system interdependencies and limitations.

 Share your knowledge of the most effective performance, scalability, architecture, and engineering patterns and methods.


A day in the life



About The Hiring Group



Job responsibilities




Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development

 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field with 1+ year relevant experience.

 Shown skill with Java, C++, or equivalent object-oriented programming languages.

 Knowledge about functional programming in Scala/Java8

 Strong problem solving and analytical abilities.

 Understanding of algorithmic design and complexity analysis.




Preferred Qualifications




 MS in Computer Science or equivalent

 2+ years of industry experience.

 Experience building scalable infrastructure software or distributed systems for commercial online services.

 Strong analytical abilities and design skills.

 Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Amazon is committed to providing accommodations at all stages through recruitment and employment in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation, including in order to apply for a position.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1768502

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Description:* The successful candidate will join our development team and work in a collaborative, Agile environment. Your contribution to the team will be crucial in evolving our front-end development for our Management System and future new product development. This person will be working on a flagship Management product. This product collects information from a device and pushing the data to the azure cloud, then visualizing it on a web application with React. The bulk of the work this person will be doing is taking their current desktop version and moving it over to a web application. This will require a lot of technology adjustments and building a framework for the web. Its going to be a "hub" landing page used to access all the different software. This landing page will be the shell that encompasses all the enterprise technology down the road. Once it is built, there will be a lot of migrating applications over time. When they start, this person will be doing a lot of learning and researching to figure out how to do this, as well as technical spikes and design pattern conversations.

Responsibilities:*

Analyze, modify, write, and implement software code related to the creation and maintenance of software applications and services

Create software requirement documentation, software design analysis and implementation

Design and produce screens and workflows that support collection and display of complex information in an easy-to-understand fashion

Analyze code and application execution for optimization and performance tuning

Produce accurate software implementation estimates and delivers upon agreed schedule

Provide input for the development and ongoing maintenance of technical documentation

Collaborate with other engineers to provide the best solution possible that conforms to best engineering practices, including writing of unit tests and code reviews

Contribute to ongoing improvements to the development process

Skills:* React, redux, C#, .net, angular, SQL, typescript, asp.net, front end, full stack

Top Skills Details:* React, redux, C#

Additional Skills & Qualifications:* MUST HAVES:

5+ years of experience working on front end development for commercial applications

Strong JavaScript and React Experience

Experience working with C#, ASP.net on back end

Experience with microservices

Experience with relational databases, including SQL Server NICE TO HAVES:

Angular

Experience working with Typescript and Redux

Experience Level:* Expert Level

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. The client fosters progressive culture, creativity, and a flexible work environment. They use cutting-edge technologies to keep themselves ahead of the curve. Diversity in all aspects is respected. Integrity, experience, honesty, people, humanity, and passion for excellence are some other adjectives that define this global technology leader.




As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing best practices and making architectural decisions to rapidly improve critical data processing & analytics pipelines. You will tackle hard problems to improve the platform’s reliability, resiliency, and scalability. 




We are looking for someone who thrives on autonomy and has experience driving long-term projects to completion. You are detail and quality oriented, and excited about the prospects of having a big impact with data. Our tech stack includes Airflow, Hive, EMR, PySpark, Presto, Jenkins, Snowflake, Datadog and various AWS services. 

 


 Qualifications 



5+ years of relevant industry experience in big data systems, data processing and SQL data warehouses 

At least 3+ years of experience on working with large Hadoop projects and building scalable applications using PySpark by leveraging Spark DataFrame and Spark SQL api. 

At least 2+ years of experience in optimizing Spark applications, spark memory management, and e2e spark process optimization. 

Strong overall programming skills, able to write modular, maintainable code, preferably Python & SQL 

Fundamental knowledge of distributed data processing systems, storage mechanisms, and compression techniques. 

Experience building code-driven infrastructure on public cloud platforms, preferably AWS 

Understanding of SQL, dimensional modeling, and analytical data warehouses, like Snowflake, Redshift 

Knowledge of Data Modeling techniques and high volume ETL/ELT design. 

Familiar with workflow management tools, like Airflow and Oozie 

Experience with CI and code management tools like Git, Jenkins 

Familiar with BI tools, like Power BI, Looker, Qlikview 

Problem solver with excellent written and interpersonal skills; ability to make sound, complex decisions in a fast-paced, technical environment 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience 






Responsibilities 



You will be tasked with modernizing and expanding a critical set of existing systems 

You will need a product-focused mindset. It is essential for you to understand business requirements and architect systems that will scale and extend to accommodate those needs 

Break down complex problems, document technical solutions and sequence work to make fast, iterative improvements 

Build and scale data infrastructure that powers batch and real-time data processing of billions of records 

Develop CI/CD ETL pipelines using Jenkins for deployment and automation testing. 

Take ownership of ETL pipelines, own data quality for your areas, and ensure SLAs are met. 

Interface with data engineers, data scientists, product managers and all data stakeholders to understand their needs and promote best practices 


 


Good to have: 



Any Certification in Spark 

Good Understanding of AWS EMR ecosystem and deploying spark applications on EMR.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon is investing heavily in building a world class Advertising business and the Worldwide Advertiser Success team (WASE) is at the head of this growth machine enabling our teams to deliver at scale. Our goal is to scale account management multifold by investing in strategic self-service applications that improve productivity of external advertising customers and internal account management executives.

This is a relatively new team, with a focused initiative, looking for a motivated Software Development Engineers with a proven track record of building web applications and services at scale. We’re a fast-growing team with high visibility from the leadership team and lots of new opportunities in the next growth driver for Amazon.

Providing a scalable platform to support millions of Amazon advertising customers to self-service their advertising campaigns is a complex architectural challenge. Our systems support large multi-billion dollar brand owners as well as small sellers. You will be empowered to think big, invent on behalf of our customers, make judgment calls and find elegant solutions to hard problems. Amazon advertising is changing fast and this is a dynamic role where you will both learn and grow while you contribute to our success



As a Software Development Engineer, You Will




 Collaborate in the design, implementation, and deployment of successful internet-scale systems and services to support advertising business.

 Help define our secure, scalable and distributed systems.

 Work closely with senior engineers, UX designers, product managers and data scientist delivering demanding projects.

 Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

 Understand system interdependencies and limitations.

 Share your knowledge of the most effective performance, scalability, architecture, and engineering patterns and methods.


Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior engineers provide support to new engineers through design guidance and code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We use agile development strategies and want software engineering leaders who can thrive in a fast paced, high-energy work environment.




Basic Qualifications




 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience

 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design




Preferred Qualifications




 MS in Computer Science or equivalent

 4+ years of industry experience.

 Experience building scalable infrastructure software or distributed systems for online services.

 Strong object-oriented design skills with understanding of common design paradigms

 Willingness to own all stages of development process: requirement gathering, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

 Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.

 Well-rounded engineering skills; full-stack development experience - web + services


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1934713

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Description:* This fully remote firmware developer position is for a forward thinking and established company who is looking for intermediate to higher level candidates to make a difference on an existing product. The role will focus on bare metal, driver development where you work your way up the stack, they and focuses mainly on low level programming. Additionally, professional working experience with RTOS is a strong addition. This position has an RTOS that can create tasks, scanning analog, and digital inputs. The code base is in C and would require professional experience working with C at the lower level. The project will be focusing on debugging and patching up the product while working in a sustaining environment. This contract will not be building on the product. This position is looking for someone who can come in and make a difference right away not someone who will need onboarding or training. The product is a renewable energy product that focuses on solar power and batteries.

Skills:* Microcontroller Programming (4+ years of professional experience) RTOS (4+ years of professional experience) Firmware C (4+ years of professional experience)



NICE TO HAVES:

Electronics experience (has knowledge of what a resistor and capacitor are)


Experience Level:* Intermediate Level

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Position Summary:* Actalent is a global leader in engineering services and is a subsidiary of the Allegis Group, North America’s largest privately-held human capital solutions company. Actalent is continuing to build a software division and strengthen its engineering capabilities in Montreal. We operate out of a new engineering facility in Ville Saint-Laurent and have a very collaborative and cohesive work environment. The reason for this opening is that Actalent is investing in making several long-term hires to build a critical mass on its software team. Actalent‘s hiring package for full-time position includes a comprehensive medical benefits package, training and development program, personal and sick days, etc. This position is focused on software and algorithm development of ADAS functionalities using camera systems. In this role, you will work in an agile development team to create ADAS functions and features for customer projects. As an agile software developer, you will be expected to perform the following tasks:.

Specific Tasks:*

Perform software development and requirements engineering according to the V-model.

Analyze customer requirements and create related subsystem and module requirements.

Create design documentation in both text and model-based formats.

Implement logic for new features and/or modify existing logic to realize the design.

Perform reviews for requirements, designs, and implementations, as well as support other team members with theirs.

Follow the defined software development processes, while proactively pushing to improve and streamline all areas of the process.

Support module testing for assigned software components.

Work closely with Requirements Owners / Project Managers to develop quality test cases.

Analyze and document test data and results.

Support validation on system / vehicle level as well as customer validation trips.

Communicate with other Software Developers globally to share knowledge and lessons learned.

Required Skills and Experience:*

Bachelors Degree in Electronics, Electrical Engineering, Instrumentation, Computer Science or related

Strong programming skills in C++ (2+ years experience)

Desired Skills and Experience:*

1+ years of experience working in automotive companies (Tier 1 or OEMs)

Experience with computer vision, image processing and machine learning

Familiarity with image stitching as part of ADAS environment

Familiarity with development environments such as MATLAB

Prior experience in automotive software development

Experience working in feature teams using Agile / SCRUM methodologies

Experience in using continuous integration SW development workflows

Experience in software debugging on embedded target.

Familiar with unit test frameworks like GoogleTest, Cantata++, …

Experience in working w/ vehicle network messages (CAN, Flexray, Ethernet)

Familiarity with automotive processes like ASpice, ISO26262

Experience in requirements engineering (e.g. w/ Rational Doors)

Rapid prototyping and scripting using Python, etc. Actalent thanks all applicants- only selected qualified candidates will be contacted

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Are you passionate about enabling millions of customers around to world buy anything, anywhere, anytime? Dealing with large scale distributed systems, orchestrating the entire retail ordering workflow?

We, the ordering team, need strong software development engineers, able to dive deep into abstract problems and come up with innovative designs to help us continuously make our platform ready for our current and future challenges.

SDEs at Amazon work on real world problems on a global scale, own their systems end to end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts hundreds of millions customers around the world. At Amazon an SDE can expect to design flexible and scalable solutions, and work on some of the most complex challenges in large-scale computing by utilizing your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. Come to Amazon and work in one of our teams in the eCommerce services group.




Basic Qualifications




 2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems

 3+ years of programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 4+ years of professional software development experience

 2+ years of experience as a mentor, tech lead OR leading an engineering team


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field, or 10+ year relevant work experience


 10 or more years’ experience in software development

 Full Computer Science proficiency in OO design, data structures and algorithm design

 Proficiency in a modern programming language such as C++ or Java




Preferred Qualifications




 Demonstrated ability to work around big, complex problems with ambiguous nature

 Ability to think abstractly and communicate concise way forward

 Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems architecture, algorithms, and relational databases

 Excellent team player

 Strong communication skills both verbal and written

 Strong, object-oriented design and coding skills (C/C++ and/or Java preferably on a UNIX or Linux platform)

 Experience with Data warehouse technologies

 Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions

 Experience with system architecture/design

 Experience with distributed systems operating in a scalable/high volume environment

Job ID: A1936985

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Test Developer, Algorithms




About The Team



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


Who you are



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across.



What you will do 




Technical




Design, develop, and support automated tests and corresponding infrastructure enhancements

Analyze, scope, review, and estimate test development activities

Develop test strategies and plans




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where testers and developers share the same objectives.



What we are looking for 




Required




4+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Strong programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Want to transform the way people enjoy music and radio? Come join the team that brought Amazon Music, Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM, Apple Music, TuneIn, Audible books, Kindle books, Podcasts, and more to Alexa customers. We are innovating and changing the way our customers interact with media services and devices!

Alexa Music team is responsible for the music experience for customers on the go. We define the customer experience for next generation of mobile devices. It is Day 1. Join us to become the founding member of a new initiative that involves Alexa, Music, mobile devices, and Internet of Things.

In this role, you will design, define, and deliver a new, greenfield product to enable music service providers like Spotify and Pandora to integrate and cast their music to Alexa Devices in a friction free and efficient way.

Key job responsibilities

Want to transform the way people enjoy music and radio? Come join the team that brought Amazon Music, Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM, Apple Music, TuneIn, Audible books, Kindle books, Podcasts, and more to Alexa customers. We are innovating and changing the way our customers interact with media services and devices!

Alexa Music team is responsible for the music experience for customers on the go. We define the customer experience for next generation of mobile devices. It is day 1. Join us to become the founding member of a new initiative that involves Alexa, Music, mobile devices, and Internet of Things.

You will own the end to end solution to deliver the best customer experience for music and radio on the go. You will be working closely with business partners, product managers and engineering leaders from partner teams in Speech Recognition, Research Sciences team, Devices teams, and UX.

As Mobile Software Development Enginer (iOS or Android), you will be responsible for building innovative mobile applications, frameworks and SDKs. You will work with internal and external partners, take on challenging problems at scale, and given autonomy to deliver.

A day in the life

Work within your team of engineers, product management, other engineering teams, and 3rd party developers within an agile process to define stories and tasks, fix defects, build new functionality and support our new product.




Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development

 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.)

 Some experience (industry, projects, or personal) of mobile (iOS/Android) software development

 Experience with the tools of the trade, including a variety of modern programming languages (Java, C#, Objective C, Swift ,React)




Preferred Qualifications




 MS, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.

 1+ years of industry experience developing mobile (iOS/Android) applications

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been leading the world into the cloud computing era since its inception in 2006. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is the vital ecosystem we have created with our tens of thousands of consulting and technology partners, to promote AWS in every industry, every size of company, and every region of the world. APN offerings include validating partner qualifications in distinct areas, lead/opportunity sharing, training and certifications, marketing assistance, funding reimbursement, et al. The AWS Partner Systems team is responsible for external and internal supporting Partner Sales, the APN, and other elements driving the AWS partner ecosystem. We serve three groups of stakeholders: partners who work with us to sell AWS, customers who use AWS, and internal users responsible for driving AWS sales and adoption via partners.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Are you interested in building secured, highly available, performant, and scalable systems, web services, products and integrations between cloud and on-prem applications that support AWS' current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you have a passion for ensuring a positive customer experience? This is the job for you.

AWS Partner Systems is looking for a results-oriented, self-driven individual who can help us create the next generation of distributed, scalable systems that support AWS' current and future business needs. In this role, you will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, relish working with high volume of data, the challenge of highly complex business contexts that are typically being defined in real-time. You will design and develop services that processes millions of transactions in secured environment.

As Salesforce Developer, you'll be a core member of the team supporting all of our partners. While the Salesforce.com platform will be your strongest focus, you'll be willing and able to learn and support other technologies such as AWS services , as needed. You will build highly secured, scalable, extendable, and performant solutions. Working closely with product and tech teams. You will design, build, test, iterate and deploy new features, system integrations, enhancements to existing features, and provide operational support. You'll play a leading role in code reviews, guiding junior resources towards better designs and clean, standardized coding.

Work/Life Harmony

Our team puts a high value on work-live harmony. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Our team is located in the Seattle office but we're flexible when team members need to occasionally work from home. We generally keep core in-office hours from 10am - 5pm. About half of us come in earlier and the other half of us stay later.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee- led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.




Basic Qualifications




 3+ years of post-internship, hands-on engineering experience on the Force.com platform

 3+ years of experience with Visualforce, Apex and/or SOQL/SOSL

 4-year college degree in computer science or computer engineering; alternate degrees that seem related may be considered; higher amounts of overall work experience may also be considered, in lieu of the 4-year degree




Preferred Qualifications




 Graduate degree in relevant area such as computer science, software engineering or information systems

 Proficiency in related web technologies (HTML/CSS, , frameworks such as , libraries such as jQuery)

 Proficiency in related integration technologies (JSON, XML, REST, SOAP)

 Force.com certifications - Administrator, Developer, Advanced Developer, Architect

 Experience with Force.com Communities and Lightning

 Prior experience as a dev, web dev, or dev on other technologies

 Knowledge of Agile practices, particularly sprint planning and estimation

Company Overview:


Established in 2011, Birdseye has pioneered the Remote Facility Supervision industry with a mission to make the world a safe place. Facilities across North America are signing long-term contracts to have their facilities supervised and/or secured by Birdseye’s dedicated team of more than 350 professionals.




Birdseye’s well-integrated technology solution eliminates the need for costly on-site security guards or general administrative staff. Our strong belief is that any work function that can be digitized, can, and eventually will be operated remotely. Birdseye, an essential service, is proudly serving other essential services making it recession proof and stable during all economic cycles.




Birdseye is headquartered in Toronto with offices in the USA and Serbia. To learn more about our culture, kindly visit our website www.bvpserbia.com as well as our LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook pages.





Job Purpose:





You will be working on a novel, patent-pending software solution for remote video surveillance and facility monitoring, combining audio/video streaming, machine learning and business transaction processing. Our new colleague is expected to work on designing, implementing and documenting all aspects of infrastructure for the software system we are developing from scratch.





Areas of Responsibility:



Designing, provisioning, monitoring and maintaining cloud infrastructure, using infrastructure-as-code tools

Improving and maintaining CI/CD process with python, C++ and Java development teams, using containerization and code quality tools

Maintaining and administering databases on public cloud platforms

Setting up observability tools for monitoring of correctness and performance of entire infrastructure, across multiple environments






Technology Requirements: 



Experience with CI/CD tools and pipelines (such as Jenkins)

Experience with cloud platforms (such as AWS or GCP)

Experience with containerization and its use on cloud platforms (such as Docker and ECR)

Experience with relational and document databases on cloud platforms (such as RDS and DocumentDB)

Understanding of API-driven and messaging software systems

Linux based administration skills

Use of infrastructure-as-code on cloud platforms (such as Terraform) is a plus

Use of observability platforms (such as Grafana) is a plus

Experience with audio/video streaming platforms is a plus

Familiarity with either Java or C++ build systems is a plus






Other Requirements:



A degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or a related field

Good verbal and written English language skills

Ability to work with teams distributed in Canada and Serbia

job_title: Software Development Engineer, Compensation Technology, Anchor
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Would you like to work with one of the most complex employee systems in the world? Amazon Compensation Technology Team is seeking an innovative and highly motivated Software Development Engineer to join our growing organization. We are building new software products and large-scale distributed systems which will manage the compensation experience for Amazon’s rapidly growing workforce. We are empowered to think big at Amazon, and the Amazon Compensation Technology Team is doing just that. Where third-party products don’t scale to meet our needs, we build our own products which provide the scalability and flexibility we need. We take full advantage of the amazing technology toolset we have. We use AWS technologies such as Lambda, Dynamo DB, SQS, SNS, Redshift, S3, and many others to build highly scalable solutions. We directly shape the future growth of Amazon and the impact of our work can be seen all around us.

Do you find redefining and building new platforms from the ground up exciting? Do you like working with new technologies, finding new solutions to complex problems? Do you like working with all stages of product development from working with customers on business requirements to deploying and supporting your own software? We are looking for a strong Software Development Engineer who can take the lead in identifying and solving ambiguous problems. You will own and heavily influence the architecture and design, and will write a significant portion of the “critical-path” code. You will influence the team’s technical and business strategy by making insightful contributions to team priorities and approach.

Successful candidates will be strong contributors who want to learn developing innovative services in the cloud, leveraging the best technologies AWS has to offer, and build software at scale. They should also have an eye towards quality, and insist on the highest standards.




Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related technical discipline

 1+ years’ full-time experience in software design and development

 Proficiency with at least one Object Oriented language (e.g. Java, Python)

 A strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional projects

 Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers




Preferred Qualifications




 Software development experience in JSP, Spring, AWS, S3, SQS, building web services and highly scalable applications

 Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between.

 Experience working with Agile engineering practices


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1925560

industries: Software Development
description:
Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


The Service Reliability Organization’s (SRE) mission is to deliver a best-in-class customer experience by ensuring the effective delivery and support of Workday’s technology stack to our customers. The SRE organization is rapidly evolving from a reactive operations center to a proactive engineering solution provider. We're looking for others to help us grow!

We foster a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and aspirational goal setting; encouraging team members to do things differently and learn new technologies and ways of working.


About The Role


We are looking for a versatile individual responsible for providing profound quantitative and qualitative insights around service reliability, process effectiveness, and organizational performance across many touch-points and data sets.

Our ideal candidate is a creative data visualization expert who is passionate about data and has a track record of using data to make informed decisions. You have the curiosity and self-motivation to continuously learn new techniques and tools to extract value from data. You are a strong communicator with a talent for storytelling and an ability to work well across all levels of the organization.

Areas of responsibility include:


Contribute to efforts to define processes, methods and outcomes for using data as a key function of organizational decision support

Create robust data models with repeatable automated procedures to improve time to response.

Build sophisticated visualization models through the analysis of complex data from a variety of sources.

Design visualizations layouts that clearly communicate the main aspects from the underlying data

Play a role in developing and delivering key performance metrics.

Collaborate with cross functional leaders and individuals to evolve Workday’s internal data strategy.

Use existing data to discover new innovation and experimentation opportunities.




About You


We need someone who possesses the power of storytelling with analytics with a “make it happen” demeanor. You have the expertise vital to understand and address key business questions through business intelligence. You enjoy trying innovative ways to solve complex business problems. You love to learn and to share your knowledge. Most importantly, you are an effective collaborator and a phenomenal teammate who brings out the very best in everyone.


Basic Qualifications



5+ years of experience in Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics

Extensive knowledge of modern digital analytics solutions

Experience working with large, complex datasets

Experience with multiple script languages such as J/L SQL, P/L SQL, and Python




Other Qualifications



Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or related field

Expert-level experience with Jira and Atlassian products

Good Experience in data modeling, data integration, and engineering

Advanced quantitative and statistical analysis skills to address business problems

Good storytelling skills

Possess the ability to handle interpersonal relationships judiciously and professionally

Operates with a high degree of influence and accountability



As a federal contractor, Workday is requiring all new hires to verify that they are fully-vaccinated against COVID-19 within 72 hours of beginning employment with Workday, consistent with applicable law. Workday is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates who are not vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief, medical reasons, or other legally-protected reason should contact accommodations@workday.com to explore what, if any, reasonable accommodations or exemptions Workday is able to offer.

Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.


Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

industries: Software Development

description:
Arbor is seeking an experienced Development Operations (DevOps) Developer to join our team!






Meet Arbor


Arbor is a data platform that enables brands to increase their profits, and save the planet. Utilizing a proprietary sustainability data engine, Arbor provides companies with the power to measure, improve, and showcase the sustainability of their products.




We strive to build a strong and transparent company culture, so that everyone feels comfortable, included and seen. At Arbor, no one is off-limits from sharing their ideas, collaborating on projects, or just making memes. We foster an inclusive and diverse environment of people who are passionate about innovating the field of sustainability –and we have fun while doing it.

 



Join a company where sustainability isn’t just a buzzword.










The role:


Arbor is looking for a 
DevOps Developer
 to work closely alongside our CTO to develop and implement best practices to Arbor's existing architecture. 





Position Type: 
Permanent Full-Time.





Position Location:
 Preference will be given to candidates physically residing in Calgary, however, remote employees across Canada will also be considered.





What you will do:



Build and deploy new development tools and architecture on the cloud

Work on solutions to maximize horizontal and vertical scalability

Develop continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines

Work with CTO to develop best practices

Ensure plans are in place for disaster recovery






What you bring:



At a minimum, a Bachelor’s or technical degree in computer programming, software engineering, computer science, or object-oriented software development

5+ years of experience in Dev-Ops, in a similar role

Extensive enterprise level Dev-Ops experience

You must have experience with Linux 

Proven experience and competency with AWS and GitHub

Experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines

Strong communication skills

Self-starter and team player attitude

Creative problem-solving and critical thinking 

Experience with Big Data and Machine Learning architectures is considered an asset






Why Arbor?


If you want to use your skills, voice, and vision to create a more sustainable world for businesses and consumers alike, you belong at Arbor. You’ll be part of a high-growth company that is defining the new landscape of how businesses and people do good in the world.




In addition to rewarding work, we offer:


Competitive salary

Employee share plan

Competitive employee benefit plan

Flexible office/work-from-home and work hour arrangements

Unlimited vacation days

Career development

Weekly team-bonding events 

And so much more!






Sound like we’d be a good fit for each other? Apply today!





Applications for this position will close on 
Friday, April 1, 2022 at 11:59 PM.





Arbor is an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity. We are committed to creating an inclusive company environment for our people, one we are all proud to belong to. Arbor is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process.




Applicants must have legal authorization to work full-time in Canada with no restrictions.

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Join a young team of aspiring software builders who are striving to reach the next billion customers. We are working with infinite possibilities on how to innovate for new and fastest growing marketplaces for Amazon retail.

We're looking for software engineers who have strong technical design skills and are able to drive technical design of broad efforts that have high impact and visibility. This role has a number of opportunities for cross-team ownership and require cross-organizational technical leadership skills to create seamless technical designs

and solutions that reliably work end-to-end for emerging and global marketplaces.

If you are game to grow your skills as you help us grow and scale the world's most customer obsessed retail technology stack and customer obsession that fuels your thought, India Seller & Fulfillment Technology is the team that is looking for people just like you!

You will be a technical leader to drive the


 Developing highly reliable, scalable, and distributed systems.

 Delivering quality features on-time and execution against project plans and delivery commitments.

 Working with team members to manage the day-to-day development activities, participate in designs, design review, code review, implementation, and operational excellence.

 Engaging and working with customers and dependencies to ensure the quality delivery.

 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Our client, a leading manufacturer of advanced imaging systems, is currently seeking an embedded sustaining engineer for a long-term opportunity.


Description:*

They meet with the team every morning and discuss issues at hand and prioritize what needs to be worked on

They'll be re-tasked with things throughout the day as necessary - it'll be a mix of short term and long-term work, often working on multiple issues at a time

75% doing troubleshooting/debugging, 25% porting code from multiple development branches, older codebases, into new ones or the other way around (new feature into older codebase)

Will be proposing solutions to SMEs

Small customizations for current product and software builds

Top Skills Details:*

Embedded C (new grads okay as long as they have some experience working with complex systems)

Strong Written and Verbal Communication Skills (Candidate will be interacting with cross-functional teams and needs to be able to effectively take in requirements/tickets, engage with multiple SMEs on a daily basis)

Additional Skills & Qualifications:*

Experience working with customers and internal/external stakeholders

A lot of the role is being able to have that big picture overview therefore engaging with different teams is crucial

Working in a high-pressure situation, sometimes issue come up on the production floor or at the end of the production life cycle, sometimes there could be pressure to find quick solutions

Experience with electronics (knowing what a resistor is, having some sort of familiarity with electronics, doesn't have to be educational, surface-level understanding of electronics)

Understanding of PCBs, FPGAs, Schematics, Control Systems

Understanding of multithreading Thank you in advance for your interest. Due to the high volume of candidates, only those qualified to proceed through the screening will be contacted.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Our client is a major automotive manufacturer conducting research and development on electric vehicles. We're searching for entry-level computer science graduates who are interested in starting and/or developing their career with a major automotive OEM. *Job Description:* The Requirements Modeling Engineer will be involved in Modeling and Simulation of EE features and requirements (Body, Chassis, Infotainment) including semi and fully automated driver assistance systems. The Engineer is responsible for requirements modeling using IBM Rhapsody and related tasks for existing and new features. The Engineer is also responsible for performing testing and validation of EE requirement models for the vehicles. Candidate will demonstrate skills in Model Based System Engineering(MBSE) to achieve target of requirements maturation. This includes performing system level Dynamic Analysis of EE features to identify potential requirements issues and requirements maturation in accordance with the EEDP Engineering Process. In addition, the engineer will interface with multidisciplinary teams ex. Systems, VI and Platforms. The candidate must have the desire to learn new processes and technologies. Responsibilities include but not limited to: Design, Develop, Simulate and Validate SysML models and Generate EE system requirements related tasks, for example:


Be able to develop System Architecture Model framework using Harmony SE process o Be able to do analysis of existing requirements and functional objectives to identify use cases, Decomposing the use cases into activity and sequence diagrams, Build and simulate model to perform manual and automated validation. The responsibilities include AUTOSAR compliant auto code generation from UML model o Be able to annotate the SysML models to generate the EE requirements. o Be able to develop executable IBM Rational Rhapsody SysML models o Hand-off SysML model to UML Model o Auto-code generation and Integration with WPF GUI, VEOS and base software of actual ECU o Be able to establish traceability of EE requirements and Customer Functional Objectives to SysML models artifacts and using best practices of SysML model management using Doors Next Generation(DNG) and Rhapsody Model Manger(RMM). o Participate in ALM discussions to ensure that the library of SysML models and work streams are being handled in an efficient and reusable way.

To understand EE Functional Objectives and simulate requirements by developing SysML models and GUI for new and advanced EE features. Also to demonstrate these feature to Platforms, VI teams and EE Senior Management in Design reviews.

Work with Systems Teams to explain requirements issues and come up with innovative solutions and fixes.

Coach Model Based Systems Engineering for Dynamic Analysis class to team members. *Skills & Qualifications:* Base Requirements: *

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering from an ABET accredited university* *

Entry-Level - 1+ years of experience or co-op equivalent* Preferred Requirements:

Masters Degree in Computer Engineering

Demonstrated ability to apply SysML and UML methodologies for system engineering

Experience within the area of Requirements Modeling and Model Based System Engineering

Demonstrated ability to apply the V-model development process

Demonstrated competency in Systems Engineering – EE Requirements, Communications Protocols

Demonstrated competency in Requirement Modeling and MBSE

Demonstrated competency in IBM Rational Rhapsody

Demonstrated competency in AUTOSAR complaint auto code generation

Demonstrated competency in integration of auto generated code with different platforms

Trained in both VEOS and GUI creation using WPF

Work both independently and in teams following Agile methodology and practices

Good problem solving skills

Good communication and interpersonal skills ***This role is remote, with the caveat that there may be occasional day-trips to Detroit, Michigan for meetings/trainings.***

description:
Working in Actalent's engineering center based in Montreal, Canada. First project will be to support a major client of ours, Robert Bosch on exciting projects related to electronics and the automotive industry (assisted driving technologies). The person will however be hired as a long-term employee where they will join a growing team and have exposure to multiple projects from a variety of clients. We offer training, self-development programs and the opportunity for advancement. Our company culture is second to none.* This is a CAREER OPPORTUNITY, not a contractual placement.*


Description:*

Perform software development and requirements engineering according to the V-model.

Analyze customer requirements and create related subsystem and module requirements.

Create design documentation in both text and model-based formats.

Implement logic for new features and/or modify existing logic to realize the design.

Perform reviews for requirements, designs, and implementations, as well as support other team members with theirs.

Follow the defined software development processes, while proactively pushing to improve and streamline all areas of the process.

Support module testing for assigned software components.

Work closely with Requirements Owners / Project Managers to develop quality test cases.

Analyze and document test data and results.

Support validation on system / vehicle level as well as customer validation trips.

Communicate with other Software Developers globally to share knowledge and lessons learned.

As part of an agile team, support other Software Developers working in other areas to broaden your skill set and balance workload.

Top Skills Details:* C++, object-oriented programming, embedded software, embedded system

Additional Skills & Qualifications:*

The candidate must have strong experience in software development

OR* a degree in Software or Electrical Engineering

Object-Oriented C++ development experience (2+ years)

Experience working with Posix-based operating systems (Windows experience is not applicable.

Understanding of Agile methodology

Nice To Have*

1+ years of experience working in automotive companies (Tier 1 or OEMs)

Experience with computer vision, image processing and machine learning

Familiarity with image stitching as part of ADAS environment

Familiarity with development environments such as MATLAB

Prior experience in automotive software development

Experience working in feature teams using Agile / SCRUM methodologies

Experience in using continuous integration SW development workflows

Rapid prototyping and scripting using Python, etc.
